page.title: 08Priestfield Maltings
page.content: The Priestfield Maltings{is a major {landmark of Pitlessie}village.The buiding stands as a reminder of a once thriving industry ,beginning in the late 18th century, unfortunately now stopped. At one time they employed only fourteen men and produced well over 2.000 tons of{Malt}anually.This malt was sent all over the world it was even sent to North Africa and Iceland. During the war the plain Malt was sent to soldiers so that beer could be made from it.Also during the war there was a great demand for{malt extract resulting from the shortage of sugar. The Maltings therefore was a very use -ful industry for a number of years especially during the war years.All that remains is a{derelict building with a for sale sign.
